About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

I am the type of guy who loves to wear many hats. I am an artist, a musician, and a developer. I love to travel and learn new languages. During my time loving in Asia, I was lucky enough to pick up on the Chinese language and developed proficiency in spoken communication. Software has been a passion since childhood, but it wasn't until after my time in China that I realized I loved decoding language. It was in that moment that I realized my career was in development.

New Concepts Publishing

Front-End Developer

This was my first tech role. This position taught me html and css as well as time management and gave me freedom with design. Managment allowed me to wear many hats, and in doing so I learned a great deal.

National Net

System Admin

At National Net I was pushed into the world of Linux and the command line interface. Here, I worked server side to provide support for clients who's content we hosted.

New Concepts Publishing

Graphic Designer

New Concepts allowed me to take my Photoshop and illustrator skills to the next level. While working there as a front-end developer I wore many hats. One of which was graphic designer.
